image.name: O000155_001

profileText: (subsequently William Dunne), a Representative from Indiana; born in Bloomington, Ind., on September 6, 1846; attended Indiana University at Bloomington in 1865 and entered upon the study of law; relinquished law for the ministry; pastor of the Christian Church until 1878; elected as a Republican to the Forty-ninth, Fiftieth, and Fifty-first Congresses (March 4, 1885-March 3, 1891); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1890 to the Fifty-second Congress; superintendent, U.S. Office of Immigration, 1891-1893; elected secretary of state of Indiana and served from January 16, 1895, to January 15, 1899; president, Ubero Plantation Company; went to Europe and assumed the alias of William Dunne; died on May 2, 1918, in Worthing, England, United Kingdom; interment at Worthing and Broadwater Cemetery, Worthing, England, United Kingdom.
